intro: Pseudabutilon pintoi, commonly known as the Pintoi sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, showy yellow flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in warm, sunny climates and is often found in disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
